function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Impact of climate change and air pollution on pollinosis exposure","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increasing connectivity between green areas in modern cities could facilitate the spread of infectious diseases between geographically distant rat populations.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The increase in biodiversity of rodent predators may foster the introduction of certain pathogens into urban landscapes.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The presence of foxes in urban areas has increased the likelihood of the small fox tapeworm e. multilocularis occurring in city rodents and infection risk for domestic dogs and cats.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased connectivity of urban green areas may lead to higher tick populations, increasing the risk of tick-borne infections in humans.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Critique of the biodiversity-buffers-disease paradigm","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Non-linear relationship between biodiversity and dilution effect","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Adding non-competent and competent host species in city environments","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increase in biodiversity may lead to proliferation of pest and harmful organisms in urban environments.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disease-protective effects of biodiversity may not effectively reduce the transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential transmission of covid-19 in tourism destinations due to reduced risk perception and information mismanagement","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of detail-oriented behavior and increased spontaneous trait inferences leading to risk of epidemic spread","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological distance and construal level theory influencing perceived risk in tourism contexts may lead to inaccurate risk perceptions.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Individuals’ varying construal of psychological distance and covid-19-related risk perceptions may lead to inconsistent travel willingness and preferences.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in tourist preferences due to covid-19","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased preference for private transportation over public transportation","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Perceived health risks related to covid-19 in tourism activities","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Psychological risks related to anxiety and fear about covid-19","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tourists consuming foreign or exotic foods may be blamed for disease transmission, leading to social risk.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Biased risk perceptions of covid-19, with individuals perceiving their own risk as lower than others.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in risk perceptions based on demographic characteristics, cultural background, and socio-psychological features.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tourists may engage in novelty-seeking behavior, leading to increased risk of contracting contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Wildlife consumption by tourists may lead to the transmission of zoonotic diseases and global health epidemics.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Tourists modifying transportation modes to prefer self-driving tours or recreational vehicles, leading to potential increase in road accidents and traffic congestion.","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Tourists avoiding public transport due to fear of contracting illnesses, leading to decreased usage of public transport and potential overcrowding of roads and highways.","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Preference for private car services leading to decreased social distancing and increased risk of disease transmission within the vehicle.","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological reservations affecting destination choices","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased risk perception leading to modification of destination preferences","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tendency to travel with socially close companions and avoid strangers","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Tourists’ expressions of conservative attitudes may impact their behavior in ways that increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tourists avoiding high-risk areas","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Behavioral changes in response to perceived risk","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Demographic variation in response to perceived risk","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Time-related costs and frustrations due to quarantine-related measures during the epidemic.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of psychological distance on tourists’ risk perceptions and behavioral changes.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Performance risk in tourism due to covid-19 travel","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perception of higher covid-19 infection risk due to proximity to out-group members and unfamiliar environments","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological risk associated with undesirable travel experience and pandemic-related anxiety","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived uncertainty of infection and negative outcomes","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in risk perception between tourists, policymakers, and industry practitioners","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological closeness to environmental pollution leads to a more concrete threat perception and greater perceived risk.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proximate psychological distance and low-level construal may lead to reduced risk perception of covid-19, potentially impacting safety behaviors and precautionary measures.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Subjective perceived risk in travel context influences tourists’ destination choices and travel behavior.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tourism industry is highly susceptible to internal and external stimuli, including perceived risk in crisis contexts.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased perceived risk due to closer psychological distance","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proximity of temporal distance and spatial distance in relation to covid-19 increases psychological closeness and low construal, leading to a focus on immediate pandemic-related context and details.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear of covid-19 transmission to families and friends due to close social distance within the in-group, leading to protective measures and enforced quarantine measures.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Implicit associations between proximate objects and low-level construal may affect judgment and decisions unconsciously, leading to potential misjudgments of contagion risk.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological distance and construal level theory may lead to underestimation of low hypotheticality may lead to the perception of control over contagion, potentially leading to risky behavior and inadequate precautions.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
